intro: Annona uncinata, commonly known as the hooked annona, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It is a small tree or shrub that typically grows to a height of 3–5 meters. The plant produces large, heart-shaped leaves that are glossy and dark green. Its flowers are white or pale green, with a distinctive waxy appearance. The fruit is a large, spiny berry that ripens to a yellowish color and is edible when mature.
